title: Easy Pancakes Recipe (with Video)
description: This easy pancake recipe is quick to make with simple pantry ingredients. They cook up nice and fluffy for a family-pleasing breakfast or brunch.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Pancake Recipes Easy Pancakes 4.7 (1,705) 1,353 Reviews 249 Photos This easy pancake recipe doesn't require much thought early in the morning and the pancakes taste great! Submitted by Sharon Holt Updated on February 11, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 249 249 249 249 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This quick and easy pancake recipe puts the store-bought stuff to shame.  How to Make Easy Pancakes You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: Easy Pancake Ingredients You likely already have all the ingredients you’ll need to make this easy pancake recipe:  Flour: This quick pancake recipe starts with a cup of all-purpose flour. Sugar: You’ll need two tablespoons of white sugar. Baking powder: Baking powder acts as a leavening agent, ensuring perfectly fluffy pancakes. Salt: Salt enhances the overall flavor of the pancakes, but it won’t make the pancakes taste salty. Milk and oil: Milk and oil add moisture and flavor to the pancake batter. Egg: A beaten egg lends more moisture and helps bind the batter together.  Lanacowan93 How Do You Make Easy Pancakes?  Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make quick and easy pancakes at home:  Combine the dry ingredients.Add the wet ingredients and mix. Pour or ladle the batter onto the oiled griddle or pan. Cook until bubbles form, flip, and cook on the other side.  What to Serve With Pancakes Of course, maple syrup is the perfect topping for these easy pancakes. They also pair well with homemade whipped cream, blueberry compote, fresh fruit, and brunch classics such as scrambled eggs and bacon. For more delicious inspiration, explore our entire collection of Breakfast and Brunch Recipes.  How to Store and Freeze Pancakes Store leftover easy pancakes in an airtight container in the fridge for about a week or freeze them for up to two months.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “I am super happy with this recipe,” says Amber M. “I wanted a quick recipe, so I tried this. They were perfect! I did add a splash of vanilla extract to my batter for extra tastiness, but my daughter and I loved them. I may never go back to that other recipe I use. They are very fluffy. Absolutely perfect!” “Really quick and easy to make,” according to another community member. “Perfect Saturday morning breakfast for me to make for my siblings!” “I love how simple this recipe is,” raves Melissa Lopez. “The pancakes come out great every time. I add chocolate chips and my family loves it. You can’t go wrong with this recipe.” Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 cup all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons white sugar 2 teaspoons baking powder ½ teaspoon salt, or to taste 1 cup milk 2 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 large egg, beaten Directions Gather the ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl. Make a well in the center, and pour in milk, oil, and egg. Mix until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour or scoop batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake; cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 1 to 2 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side. Repeat with remaining batter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  Recipe Tip These easy pancakes are best served with homemade blueberry compote. I Made It Print 3,350 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Pancakes 01 of 249 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 249 Photo by  FizzyThyme3791 10/13/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow 03 of 249 Photo by  TrendyCup8051 02/16/2024 Great flavors Easy to follow A keeper! Quick, easy, and delicious! I used Splenda and sugar free syrup but let me just say, if the recipe is fallowed, puts IHOP at second. 04 of 249 Photo by  BriefBasil9772 01/10/2024 I am making them right now. They aren’t too thick which I like. 05 of 249 Photo by  Flor De Bregel 11/18/2023 Didn't have milk, added water and a little vanilla the result were outstanding! 06 of 249 Photo by  ToughWater8831 09/26/2023 I made it work. I added double the ingredients. 2 cups flour, 2 cups milk, 4 tablespoons sugar, 2 tablespoons olive oil (yes, I didn't double this one and used a different oil), 2 tablespoons baking powder, 2 eggs and kept it to one tablespoon salt. These came out pretty easy (I'm 21 and a spoiled girl so I almost rarely cook) for someone like me. And trust me when I tell you this, spread strawberry and whipped cream on these bad boys cause it's gonna taste good. Also 12-15 pancakes come out of this version of the recipe (each as big as the palm of a hand). 07 of 249 Photo by  Katina Vesely 08/04/2023 Best pancakes I've ever had. I didn't have any milk so I substituted with water. I added vanilla and cinnamon and topped it with Nutella and they are amazing. Will do again. 08 of 249 Photo by  I Griff 05/06/2023 Perfect. No oil needed in the pan. This was my first time making pancakes from scratch and my daughter loved them! Almost as quick as from the box and much more economical and healthy. Will keep using this. 09 of 249 Photo by  Amy Katharine 04/27/2023 I cut the baking powder in half, as that seemed a really big amount for 1 cup of flour. They still turned out fluffy and good, with no icky baking powder bitterness! I also just left out the salt. I've had better pancakes, but I needed something quick and easy to make with what I have on hand, and these fit the bill. 10 of 249 Photo by  mary sutphin 04/23/2023 Wonderful 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Kefir Pancakes 14 Ratings Vegan Pancakes 863 Ratings Rice Pancakes 25 Ratings Quinoa Buckwheat Pancakes 3 Ratings Chocolate Pancakes 124 Ratings Cornbread Pancakes 214 Ratings Ginger-Spiced Pancakes 4 Ratings Almond Puff Pancakes 5 Ratings Tasty Protein Pancakes 1 Rating Matcha Pancakes 4 Ratings French Toast Pancakes 26 Ratings Hearty Country Hot Cakes 36 Ratings Easy Flourless Banana Flax Pancakes 8 Ratings Fluffy Keto Pancakes 69 Ratings Quick and Easy Pumpkin Pancakes 7 Ratings Spelt Pancakes 23 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
